newsArray.title: Karnataka change captain mid Ranji Trophy; KL Rahul, Prasidh Krishna return for Punjab game
newsArray.description: Karnataka have opted for a leadership reshuffle ahead of a decisive phase in their Ranji Trophy 2025–26 campaign, naming Devdutt Padikkal as captain for their upcoming fixture against Punjab. The match will be played at the Punjab Cricket Association Stadium in Mohali from February 1, with Karnataka needing a win to stay alive in the race for the knockout stages.

newsArray.title: Final decision on T20 World Cup participation will be taken either on Friday or next Monday: PCB
newsArray.description: Pakistan is delaying its decision on participating in the T20 World Cup until Friday or Monday. They are considering a boycott of the India match in solidarity with ousted Bangladesh. The Prime Minister wants to support Bangladesh and discussed options, including withdrawing completely.
creator: pti

newsArray.title: Pakistan to boycott the T20 World Cup 2026 match against India? Drama continues after PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi's meeting with PAK PM Shehbaz Sharif
newsArray.description: Two days after saying that Pakistan's participation in the 2026 ICC T20 World Cup would be left up to the government, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chairman Mohsin Naqvi met with Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Monday to discuss the matter.
keywords: india vs pakistan t20 world cup 2026 match
creator: zee news

newsArray.title: Peake extends with Renegades after breakout BBL season
newsArray.description: GEELONG young gun Ollie Peake has been rewarded for an impressive start to BBL15, with the Melbourne Renegades locking him in on a new two-year deal last week. In his first year on a full BBL contract, Peake has broken out to become a key component of the Renegades’ batting attack. The 19-year-old played in [...]Read More...The post Peake extends with Renegades after breakout BBL season appeared first on Surf Coast Times.
creator: paddy sinnott

newsArray.title: West Indies name 15-member squad for T20 World Cup
newsArray.description: Cricket West Indies (CWI) have announced a 15-member squad for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026, set to begin on February 7 across Sri Lanka and India, 24NewsHD TV reported on Monday.
creator: 24 news

newsArray.title: 1,059 days on, WPL gets its first hundred — Nat Sciver-Brunt makes it
newsArray.description: Nat Sciver-Brunt etched her name in WPL history, smashing the tournament's inaugural century with an unbeaten 100 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. This remarkable feat propelled her to the top of the season's run charts and solidified her status as a dominant force in women's cricket. Her stellar performance anchored Mumbai Indians' innings, setting a formidable target.
creator: toi sports desk

newsArray.title: CJI Justice Surya Kant hosts Indian Women’s Blind Cricket World Champions
